pullRequest.title: Issue 890 ucte power plant type management
pullRequest.bodyText:
Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements (please use '[x]' to check the checkboxes, or submit the PR and then click the checkboxes)

 The commit message follows our guidelines
 Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
 Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

Does this PR already have an issue describing the problem ? If so, link to this issue using '#XXX' and skip the rest
fix #890

commit.message:
save ucte power plant type in properties

Signed-off-by: Jérémy LABOUS <jlabous@silicom.fr>

nodes.bodyText:
The simplest way to implement that, is to add a property to the generator whatever the type of the power plant. Add the property after the creation of the generator:
generator.setProperty(UCTE_POWER_PLANT_TYPE, ucte.getPowerPlantType());

Change the signature of this method to pass the generator instead of these two values.
Look for the property. If it's defined, use it. If the property is not defined, use the existing code without modifications.

commit.message:
take remark in account

Signed-off-by: Jérémy LABOUS <jlabous@silicom.fr>

nodes.bodyText: There is no good reason to make the property name dependent on the ID of the generator.
This property should be declared with the others: as it's used in both importer and exporter, the right place is UcteConstants.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -45,6 +45,12 @@
 
     private static final String[] EXTENSIONS = {"uct", "UCT"};
 
+    /**
+     * Key to store ucte power plant type in properties
+     * Concat this key with generator id
+     */
+    public static final String UCTE_POWERPLANT_TYPE_KEY = "UctePowerPlantType_";

commit.message:
Fix the implementation

Signed-off-by: Mathieu BAGUE <mathieu.bague@rte-france.com>
